dialogues.text: It takes a certain kind of courage for you to say that in front of the President of the News Division.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think anyone who's proud of the work we do is an ass kisser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I think anyone who puckers their lips and presses it against his boss' buttocks and then smooches is an ass kisser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My gosh, and for a while there, I was attracted to you. She walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute -- that changes everything.

dialogues.speaker: ON JANE
dialogues.text: At the bar getting a drink. Jennifer ENTERS THE SCENE... and leads Jane down the hall they are standing alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is very awkward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead -- what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ummm -- it's dumb dorm stuff but I see Tom around you a lot and this is such a small office and I'd like to see him outside of work, unless there's some reason for you to mind... in which case I just won't do anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God Almighty -- Whew.  Do I mind? Why do I mind?  I do mind.  What a shock -- I don't have a right to... I don't think I like him.  I know I don't respect him...So what am I talking about -- what am I saying to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're saying stay away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stupefied)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't be. She blinks in wonder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have to settle this definitively right now. Jennifer moves toward the drinking table -- Jane, unstead by the dose of self-revelation, moves towards Aaron's cir and scratches his back in friendship... Tom approaches an moves off -- not wanting to deal with him.  She takes a f breaths as she keeps walking.  We HEAR snatches of PARTY CONVERSATIONS, i.e:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me one person who ever left television news to work on a newspaper. She moves on; Tom still following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding Paul's arm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I felt so proud when he turned down News Vice President so we could stay here.  Suddenly, after all these years, we have a life. Jane turns -- sees that Tom is still looking at her from feet away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (badly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Tom. She stands there, genuinely frightened.  She must deal wi now.  He crosses to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the firs time I've seen  you dressed like this.  You look so clean and pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean clean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At work there's always this sort of film over you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thumps like me leave appearance to guys like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're great at taking the edge off a good time. Jane starts twitching.  She pauses -- holds a hand lightl his arm to steady herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Just don't say anything mean for a while.  Thanks. She meets his gaze for an instant -- and, in that instant control for the first time in her memory.  She looks stra she retreats from this glimpse of upheaval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to find someone.  It's important.  Excuse me. She walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had the strangest thing happen yesterday.  Anne and I have been married what? -- Thirty-six years... Everything fine -- two days after the promotion came through, I was checking myself in the mirror and she was making a face at me behind my back. So yesterday I looked in the mirror and she was doing it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't say anything to her? He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My instincts tell me not to. Annie comes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The office is phoning, honey. He EXITS SCENE as Anne watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope he moves that fast when it's me on the line.

dialogues.speaker: ON JANE
dialogues.text: As she passes a chair with an afghan shawl on the back -- picks it up and wraps it around herself, a bit chilled. sees Jennifer on the stairs and moves toward her calling too loud, anxiety-ridden voice as she goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer.  Hey, Jennifer.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAIRCASE
dialogues.text: Jennifer turning as Jane whips up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget what I said -- you do whatever you want to with him. She pushes at Jennifer a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there's nothing I'm going to do right this second. Jane pushes her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's a party, right? Jane smiles back feigning female bonding -- Jennifer goes down the steps and crosses to Tom.

dialogues.speaker: FULL SCENE
dialogues.text: Aaron takes in Jane, who is taking in Jennifer and Tom -- Aaron begins to sense a new dynamic in the room as Ernie and huddles briefly with Paul... The News President is in The two of them walk over to Tom and Jennifer.  We PICK U a few words:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This would be a good time to tap that source of yours.  He could have an angle or something. AARON'S P.O.V. Tom is startled but cool -- nods his head -- Jennifer is looking at Tom with new and even prettier eyes... Paul an now move toward Jane, a whole flow of movement creating a energy in the area.  Jane sheds her Afghan as she rises t them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jane)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want you to exec produce a Special Report...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Aaron has come over to join them now in time to HEAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Libyan plane shot up one of our bases in Egypt.  It's all still happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's figure out the field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, since Paul's here, he's made out the assignments... Jennifer at the White House... George at the Pentagon...Martin at State...and we need an anchor since Rorish is in his boat, so we're gonna do the whole report this afternoon from here...with Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.  I resign as of now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Aaron)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what.  I'll stay if Tom knows how to spell Gaddafi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ernie, as much as I like you, I think I have to tell Paul what I think, because this is really sort of obscenely stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane, if you want to, go ahead.  I don't disagree with you. Jane moves quickly off, awed at the prospect of taking on big boss.

dialogues.speaker: ON JANE
dialogues.text: As she moves past Tom who is talking on the phone, eventu catching up with Paul.  In the b.g. Tom has just HEARD th "BEEP" of an ANSWERING MACHINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Buddy.  It's 1:35 -- and this is Tom.  You can reach me at the office.  It's important. I can use a little help. Jane, because of the proximity to Tom is speaking in whis intensity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom isn't ready for the job you're about to hand him.  Not near ready.  Not by the longest shot.  Aaron's spent six weeks in Tripoli, he's interviewed Gaddafi -- he reported on the Eight-one story.  I think he's essential to do the job we're capable of and I think it's my responsibility to tell you that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, that's your opinion.  I don't agree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not opinion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just absolutely right and I'm absolutely wrong? She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must be nice to always believe you know better.  To think you're always the smartest person in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from her depths)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's awful.  Oh my, it's awful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to leave)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd better get moving. As they move out... Jane goes to Aaron... He moves with h towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you later -- where you going to watch from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch? --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll come by your place, right after...drink, take pills... Love you. She runs out the door.  Aaron turns mean and mocks Jane's last words -- screwing up his face in a savage burlesque.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, love you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jane briefly pauses to see which war has room.  Tom op the passenger seat of his car -- she gets in.  It moves o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it moves off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nervous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excited. Jane looks over at him -- there's no question he's just t the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the b.g. we SEE the Bureau Newsroom beginning to pulse activity.  Tom closes the door.  He sits down behind his and opens a bottom drawer -- a clean whit shirt lies ther He opens the center drawer -- two ties are inside.  He pi one.  He reaches for a package of new red suspenders.  He off the shirt and puts on the new one -- all of this the of an expert craftsman.  By the time he finishes he looks the authority figure we know he's now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane is NOT hyper.  She is purposeful -- organized -- eve calming Blair with a little physical contact -- a touch o the arm, to still her colleague's hysterical demons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell George and Jessica to try and cover everything without Tom having to ask additional questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Bobbie says...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear what I just said -- do you have that?  Take a breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a breath, then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. In the b.g. Tom has exited his office and looks about -- waiting for some indication as to what to do next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the most important thing make sure his earpiece works, have back-ups ready.  That's never been more vital.  He must be able to hear me at every second and clearly. Jane sees him.  She moves across the room -- takes Tom by arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have twenty minutes -- you can wait in the studio. Tom coughs nervously into his hand and takes a pen from a nearby desk, clips it into his inside pocket and walks of

dialogues.speaker: GRAPHICS ROOM
dialogues.text: Jane is screening and asking corrections in a graphic representation of an F-14 shooting down a Libyan Air Forc Mirage Fighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put in the radar plane that spotted them to begin with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have no pictures on file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't draw -- but this is a rough idea. She uses the stylus from the ELECTRONIC PAINT MACHINE to an American Air Force E-2C Hawkeyes Radar Plane.  Her wor stunning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has a glass in hand -- some chips on the table with a bottle of wine as he selects a Cassette Desk to play.  He a French song -- looks at some of his books.  He might ev read.  He is feigning disinterest for an audience of no o He SINGS ALONG with the RECORD in perfect French.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom checking copy in the long hallway leading to the stud there is the merest of hubbubs causing him to look up.  B is being stopped at the other end of the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to check first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a bit frantic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then check -- but hurry -- There he is!!! Buddy runs the length of the hallway to Tom's aide despit gestures to slow down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  You didn't have to come here. It's just that I'm going to anchor this special report on this Libyan thing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (delighted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anchor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused despite situation)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, stop!  I wondered if you could find out anything about what's happening. (on Buddy's reaction)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I broke up with my roommate -- He was really the magnet for everyone who knew anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I can start up with him again if you really...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I'm doing fine...Look. Tom stands there -- a man at home in this media castle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  He's on the world's longest ego trip, let him take it alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, okay.  Look Buddy -- I've  got to go to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...good-bye then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll speak to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, who knows.  Just let m tell you what my favorite teacher ever, told me -- 'Don't be afraid to be wonderful.' He leans forward, gives Tom a quick embrace, a small kiss the cheek.  Tom turns and walks off down the hallway to m his immediate destiny as Buddy looks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane mounts some steps in the control room -- she moves p the DIRECTOR and TECHNICAL CREW up to the next level wher two news execs, Ernie and Paul stand with their backs to wall, and then up one more step slightly above the desk a table occupied by Blair.  Now she slips into the large we paddled throne-like seat -- as WE BEGIN MUSIC CUE. Literally at her fingertips is the row of buttons which p immediate access to the field reporters at the Pentagon, and the White House.  In front of her the bank of monitor Technical Team and past them the studio where Tom is seat Anchor, a FLOOR PRODUCER and WRITER feeding him copy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she looks at Jane, poised to control the complicated a of minds and machines comprising the big time network new And Jane Craig is at the helm.  Blair experiences a flash emotion which transcends envy and verbalizes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto to Jane)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Executive Producer -- wow. Jane looks at her and, in a moment of atypical merriment, a choking gesture at her own throat as the monitors flash graphic reading:  SPECIAL REPORT... We HEAR an ANNOUNCER' say, "This is a Special Report from..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each of four buttons labeled so that the microphone can c her to Tom and the Field Reporters.  She presses the butt marked "Tom."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear me, Tom?  Tom?  Tom? Damn it...He can't hear me... (to Blair)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you if there was one thing... Tom's VOICE on speakers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice over; relaxed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can hear you.  I was just teasing. Gulping the air in relief, she slumps nonetheless impress the macho cool as: Tom smiles towards her then -- poises himself just as the Announcer's last words clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...in Washington, Tom Grunick. He begins his report.  He seems authoritative, compelling in a low key way.  We trust him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good afternoon.  A Libyan fighter plane attacked a United States Military Installation early this morning and was, itself, shot down by American F-14 Interceptors. Another monitor shows the Graphic running.  In the b.g. t men approaches Paul.  They look out of place, decidedly non-business like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Moore, I'm Marvin Usher and this  is my brother, Stuart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now!!! (gesturing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Libyan Missile destroyed an Army Warehouse which, just thirty minutes earlier, had been crowded with  servicemen.  No one was injured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron is seated, feet up, drinking, listening to MUSIC -- a book, two remote controls are on the cushion next to hi SINGS OUT LOUD with the record as he reads -- at one poin providing his own lyric line OVER THE MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SINGING LOUDLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I can read while I sing. He picks up the television remote-control device an puts television on, the SOUND OFF.

dialogues.speaker: ON TV
dialogues.text: We SEE the graphic of the Libyan plane's flight route, it missile firing -- the U.S. planes taking off and the shoo down of the Mirage jet... At one point Aaron lowering the and raising the TV SOUND hearing Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The heat seeking missile virtually disintegrated the  plane on... Aaron turns down the TV SOUND and turns up the MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane's hand flicks at the button marked "PENTAGON."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George, you're ready.

dialogues.speaker: ON PENTAGON MONITOR
dialogues.text: We SEE George and HEAR him through Jane's voice box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I cover everything or should I save something for Tom to ask about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cover everything! George nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hitting Tom's button)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to George.  Say 'the Joint Chiefs are meeting -- we have George Weln at the Pentagon'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George Weln is at the Pentagon where the attack launched by the lone Libyan pilot has resulted in a massive movement of military might.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where he still balances STEREO and TV SOUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of alliteration from anxious anchors placed in powerful posts. He picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Blair hands it to Jane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Aaron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think the pilot that shot down the Libyan in 1981 is stationed right here.  Maybe you could get him -- and maybe Tom should say that our F-14 is one of the hardest planes to fly. They're nicknamed 'Tomcats'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. (to Tom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The F-14 is one of the most difficult planes to master. (remembering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you call them 'Tomcats' and in the 70's the first crop had a number of crashes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George, isn't the F-14 Tomcat one of  the most difficult machines for a pilot to master?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're right -- it's certainly one of our hottest planes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say it here -- it comes out there. He giggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was trouble with them in the early days -- back in the 70's. Aaron dials again... As we SEE Jennifer standing at the White House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me again.  Hi.  Listen Gaddafi doesn't foam at the mouth or anything.  When you speak to him he's not at all nuts. He seems like a leader -- very impressive, self-control...that's what's so strange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right and we have the '81 pilot on the way in -- Nobody else will have him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome.  Sow how does it feel to...I know you gotta go -- Me too.  We're very busy here. He hangs up -- LONG SHOT... Aaron with his remote control The picture switches back to Tom.  He turns UP the VOLUME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...outlaw nation but strangely those who have interviewed Gaddafi find him, in a phrase we like to use in this country, very 'presidential'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice, Jane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane is on the phone.  The atmosphere buckling with strai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a minute. Her finger hits the "Tom" button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To State for the message from Libya, then you'll have the carrier pilot from the Sidra in time to... (a sudden shriek)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  No!

dialogues.speaker: ON TOM
dialogues.text: Jolted by the shriek in his earpiece but nonetheless cont

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO JANE
dialogues.text: As she SCREAMS INTO the phone -- this is more than volume is over-the-top livid, her face red, neck cords popping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We only have ten minutes left -- how can you talk to me about parking problems?  No, not you'll try...you'll do it -- do it or I'll fry your fat ass, Estelle.  Good-bye. As she BANGS the PHONE down.  Paul comments sotto to Erni

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had no idea she was this good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hitting Tom's button)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fill for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fluidly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The latest message seems to indicate that the Libyan pilot was acting on his own without authority from anyone else. (into camera directly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In other words, I think we're okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING CAMERA FROM Tom's left profile TOWARDS HIS RIGHT P TAKING IN THE Production Assistant who madly shuffles pag even as Tom talks on camera, the monitor through which he the subject of his interview at the Pentagon, the cluster assistants on the floor and now WE CONTINUE TO CIRCLE BEH beginning to SEE the Control Room in the b.g. and as we M TOWARDS HIS EAR, the white ear piece firmly in place, we TO HEAR, the barely audible crackle of Jane's VOICE as sh him roughly what to say and how long he has to say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...So, Commander, it must have been a bit tougher today -- shooting down the French-made Mirage Jet.  The one you got was a SU-22...etc... And NOW ALL IS OBSCURED EXCEPT THE ANCHOR'S EARS, the ear and the RED LIGHT on the CAMERA and beyond... almost an a vision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Once again:  The Libyan Government has disavowed any prior knowledge of the flight.  This has been Tom Grunick reporting from Washington. The special report ended, Jane breathes a breath -- she a Blair momentarily grasp hands.  The first talk concerns T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was brilliant.  I've never been as proud of one of my decisions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls back to Jane)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great work, Jane, really -- You know? Really. She nods... totally depleted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there were no major gaffs anyway. Ernie scoffs in her direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, everybody. She exits the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Usher brothers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was important for Tom -- there's that bonding thing that happens with the public and an anchorman during a crisis.  It's not the conventions anymore; it's this kind of moment. Tom enters.  He is exuberant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a baptismal.  Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.  With all the help you get, it's sure easier than local. Paul and Ernie exchange a glance. TOM (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Jane?  I'm still juiced. Ernie points off... as Tom exits.  The Usher brothers hov

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Usher brothers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're here to play the new news theme.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New theme?  You don't need me for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay.  Why should I be the only one to feel silly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need a synthesizer -- but this will give you an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead. (to Ernie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't he great?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It worked. Man Two has the keyboard out and begins playing the prosp news theme:  a suite meant to have majesty and drive, a t composition -- the effect of it somewhat lessened by the that the two men VOCALIZE OTHER INSTRUMENTS over the keyb

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Tom makes his way across it -- crews are drifting in.. enters Jane's cubby, flushed with the electricity of the the most noteworthy moment of his working life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an amazing woman.  What a feeling having you inside my head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a bit thrown)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  It was an unusual place to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indescribable -- you knew just when to  feed me the next thing, just a split  second before I needed it.  There was a  rhythm we got into, like great sex. Jane looks at him and nods slightly -- an unconscious spa truthfulness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to celebrate with me, don't you?  Everybody's going to that bar on the corner, 'Caps.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going over to Aaron's.  Maybe I'll hoop up with all of you later.  How long do you think you'll be there? Tom indicates that it's an impossible question to answer. enters the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As several people cross the street towards the bar.  Tom been holding back on one question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's tempting to ask you how you think I did. (she starts to reply)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I'm enjoying myself.  Take it easy. He starts across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to be casual)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I'll see you over there. Indicates Bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll never show up. He starts across the street -- then turns and calls to he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll wait for you till seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Tom races to catch up with the others -- Jane in the dist pauses a beat before walking off in the opposite directio moving quickly along. SOUND OF MEN VOCALIZING NEWS THEME comes UP AND continues through:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jane approaches and is surprised to find him sitting o stoop outside.

dialogues.speaker: ON AARON
dialogues.text: Happy to see her, rising fairly soberly to his feet.  He as she comes toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  It was good. He nods and APPLAUDS some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your calling in that information -- you're the classiest guy I know. He waves her off... And sits down on the stoop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was strange to watch him.  What's the next step?  Lip synching? She sits a step or two above him, waiting to gauge his mo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been doing some of the most important thinking of my life.  I wonder if this is the right time to tell you about it. She steals a glance at her watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, whatever you think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured out exactly why it is I'm so hung up on getting a chance at weekend anchor...It's because if I do that well, they'll pay me more, treat me great and my life will be better.  That's why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like you may be on to something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which means I'm at their mercy and who wants that?...I'm not going to tell you where this thought led me... Anyway, well, why not  tell you? -- it's a happy thing.  In the middle of all this I start to think about something that does nothing but make me feel good and makes immediate sense and that's you ...And I'll stop here but, Jane, I'd give anything if you were two people so I could call up the one who's my friend and tell her about the one I'm in I...I don't think I should go any further.  Come on -- I'll walk you to the corner. He tales her by the arm and leads her to the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know you've had a strange day... I'd sleep on all these things you've been thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely...You go have a good time... You have some place to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. He grabs her and hugs her exuberantly -- takes her face i hands and kisses her full on the lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I felt something. He leaves her on the corner and walks back.

dialogues.speaker: ON JANE
dialogues.text: As the SOUND OF NEWS THEME VOCALIZING PICKS UP ONE MORE.. Jane moving quickly, hailing a cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to Caps Bar at Seventeenth and Vermont; Connecticut is clear on Sunday... take that over to Fifteenth, then around Vermont and we'll bypass the circle that way...if you don't go over forty we should catch mostly green lights. ON the DRIVER'S annoyed look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on -- don't take it the wrong way.  I just know about things. He hits the meter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the cab pulls up, Jane gets out and pays him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great route.  I never made anywhere near that fast before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks -- good driving --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.  Coming from you I appreciate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. As she turns to enter the restaurant -- Tom and Jennifer As they confront each other:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think you'd make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I thought I'd check if all of you were still here.  I'll just go in and join the gang and you two go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no gang in there -- We were the last ones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'll go in and have a bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jennifer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer, you want to have another drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I know how to have a burger by myself.  I feel like a little solitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as they move off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sure know that feeling.  Terrific work today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (too jock-like)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right back to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for getting me through. He puts his hand behind her neck in an awkward gesture of camaraderie.  She awkwardly disengages... waves and steps inside the door to the restaurant... standing there betwe the two sets of doors watching Tom and Jennifer walk away

dialogues.speaker: ON TOM AND JENNIFER
dialogues.text: As they walk to his car, first exchanging a look of refle over Jane... then bumping accidentally, then bumping back look, then kissing with passion, wrapped around each othe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Tom and Jennifer rush in locked in an embrace, sheddin clothes even as they enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are aware of MOVING FORMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intense shout)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn all you sons-of-bitches.  Oh shit, you bastards... They finish.  A beat, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: ON TOM AND JENNIFER
dialogues.text: Tom taken aback by the outburst from this woman he's just love to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's okay...People say different things.  They do...the plural threw me. She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last time I was with someone we went through this awful mutual disease questionnaire but I guess it beats getting paranoid the next day.  Okay, I'll go first.  I haven't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopping her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would never occur to me to worry at all about you. Jennifer is touched...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know something?  I'm deeply complimented.   Isn't it strange to be deeply complimented because the man you're with doesn't think you have a venereal disease?... Tom slides out of bed naked -- she moves quickly across t one outstretched hand reaching for his ass, a free -- eve sort of motion punctuated by her comment:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me some of that. He dances away -- out of range -- liking the action, a st grin on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the closet. He opens the door and turns on the light in the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a converted room -- given over the racks of clothes shoes extraordinarily well organized.  Tom stands there a Various rain coats -- clothes for all climates -- lots of luggage. She joins him in the closet -- holding out a sheet in fro her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I converted a bedroom -- this stuff builds up.  Wait till you've been doing this sixteen years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not knocking it.  It's a great solution.  Not only the storage but you can see everything you have. Jennifer laughs -- he follows her gaze and sees himself i silhouette against the door -- his penis prominent in out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you do bunny rabbits? Tom is enjoying himself immensely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't this a great date? We HEAR the SOUND OF SCRATCHING as we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane feeds another tape in -- she is taking editing notes and SCRATCHING her arm.  She looks worn out -- STOCK FOOT STATESMEN move across the small screen.  She sighs and, w realizing, implores the heavens to help cure a malady she to recognize in herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God help me. People have begun to filter into the newsroom in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Jane.  How long have you been here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long time.  I was restless. Will you crack my neck? He starts massaging her neck as the phone rings.  she let ring for a beat as Aaron works on her.  As she picks up t receiver we HEAR a CRACK.  She reacts to it at the same t she utters a greeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaah -- (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- ello.  You sure they said the management meeting? (hangs up; then to Aaron)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want me to be at the management meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not that dumb, after all. He pats her on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know you're the second woman in network news history to produce?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (though distracted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not.  I'm the fourth. Joan Richmond.  Pauline Fredericks got that credit once on a U.N. special and there's Susan Zirinsky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul is running the meeting from behind Ernie's desk. TWO OTHER NON-EDITORIAL MEN are in attendance.  As Paul discusses the more pressing problems of the network news division, Jane sits near the window strangely unmoved by her first moment at the seat of power.  She has the blues

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, they seem to be very serious about making me out eight million from the budget and that means massive firings. I'm doing everything I can... It's too early to make up a 'death list' but I just wanted you to be aware of the situation... We're also going to cover the Alaskan serial killer trial on a continuing basis.  I'd like it done out of Washington which means we've got to get somebody on a plane for Anchorage. We can't fool around anymore...Jane... She looks up at him -- a bit sleepy-eyed. PAUL (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is going to be high-profile on the Evening News -- who do you think? George Weln or Jennifer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (much, much too quickly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer. The men look at her curiously.  She repeats herself more rationally. JANE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has been reading from a respectable stack of mail -- J appears in his doorway.  For the first time, we notice th she is woefully ba at at least one endeavor -- flirting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, I'll buy you a drink. There's a big thing over at the Italian embassy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure I'd be good company tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (self-conscious joke)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be the judge of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they walk in -- one MAN looks at Tom with a glint of recognition.  Then another -- a handshake -- A WOMAN intr herself.  A small knot of people form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's much too soon for you to have this kind of buzz around you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I have to stand here in the middle and meet them all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get you through.  Move and smile. (she pushes him a little)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And smile and move... They start crossing the room -- he is moving now, making But an EGYPTIAN BUSINESSMAN stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it safe for me to fly home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  We're fine now.

dialogues.speaker: AND SMILE.
dialogues.text: He smiles -- people smile back.

dialogues.speaker: STAIR LANDING
dialogues.text: Where Aaron (Pimm's Cut in hand -- a cucumber sticking ou stands with Martin Klein.  Martin is eating from a huge p of appetizers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Italians serve the second best things right after the Chinese...I could do an article comparing Embassy food...Gourmet free-loading...sell it anyplace.  I'm sure not getting the assignments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the heck could that be? AARON'S P.O.V. From the excited group of people blocking his view, it's clear there is some personage in attendance.

dialogues.speaker: ON AARON
dialogues.text: And now he sees that it's Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is God testing me or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul loves him.  I heard him give him the most poetic compliment in his command.  'He's hot.'  Sometimes groups of executives get together just to say that work back and forth...'He's hot, oh, she's hot.  Oh, he's really hot.'  Hot-hot-hot-hot-hot-hot-hot... (looking at Aaron)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, you're not allowed to use the word 'we' or I'm moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sudden thought)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe Jane would like my food idea as a spot...Try the one in the middle. He moves off to intercept Jane -- as he stops her... Tom stranded -- then sees Aaron and moves over to his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Aaron...What's doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same old stuff.  I'm watching a man who won three Overseas Press Awards pitch an hors d'oeuvre idea. A MAN stops and introduces himself to Tom -- shaking his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to go out there -- (indicating balcony)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: get out of this for a second?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you lead?  I'll just follow the flurry you cause. Tom turns -- the sharpness of the tone unsettles him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I do to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've made my dreams silly. Tom decides not to deal with the remark.  He's jolted by hostility.  He leads the way out French Doors to a ground terrace, where Aaron joins him, closes the door and the t stare at the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gesturing at the party)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heavy hitters. Aaron nods. They look inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (several beats; then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (warming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.  Network news, Washington... I love it.  What do you do when your real life exceeds your dreams?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it to yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the other day I really wanted your reaction to how we did with the Libyan report -- I was going to ask but I guess I feel a little intimidated with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, stop it. On Tom's reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't talk about feeling intimidated when you're on top of the world.  It's unseemly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not buying into any of that.  I have a load to learn.  I'm not going to act as if...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finishing for him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have the job you have... The sudden debate is important to Tom -- but it's moving fast for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up a second...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amiably)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Pretty petty party, isn't it, pal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picking his words)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made one rule for myself when this started and I realized I was going to take a lot from you people because of being from sports...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the rule was...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never to pretend to know more than I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you name all the members of the Cabinet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flustered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's drop it.  I didn't mean I'd take a test for you -- I mean if that came up in conversation I'd...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're conversing...Oh my, the names of the entire Cabinet has slipped my mind.  What are they? Tom is getting pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (compromising)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't name them.  Just tell me if you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Aaron.  I know the names of the Cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. A beat. AARON (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All twelve?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are only ten. Aaron's suddenly a good deal happier -- damned if it isn't a little infectious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're feeling good, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sincerely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm starting to... We may do the capitols of the states.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty, right? Aaron almost smiles. Tom enters the party leaving the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron in the f.g. -- his BACK TO CAMERA... Beyond him Tom being approached... then joining Jane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Tom's car comes to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so exhausted.  Punchy.  Sick tired.  I can't think and I can't move. I'm just a dead lump of poured out flesh. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to come up? Tom thinks -- then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we could just sit here -- talk a little?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  You didn't like the party, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too many smart people in one room -- it's not healthy... Jane's confused by this.  She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to have to do a story from beginning to end on my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eventually.  Does it have to be right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, I wouldn't be doing this unless it was absolutely necessary. I have an idea for something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just read about it in a magazine and it affected me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I tell you, can you manage not to put it down or tell me why it won't work or is in bad journalistic taste or anything like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (broadly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Tom -- I think I can manage. He turns towards her -- about to stick his chin out.  Hes JANE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about women who are attacked by someone they know on a date... 'Date-rape,' that's the piece... Well? Jane clamps a hand over her own mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay -- good move.  Keep it there. She continues to clamp her mouth shut as he exits the car opens her door and then begins to half carry, half pull h She keeps her hand clamped over her mouth.  Laughing from behind her door and runs for it.

dialogues.speaker: ON TOM
dialogues.text: His spirits lifted.

dialogues.speaker: ON JANE
dialogues.text: Behind the door, trying to hide the glow in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone rings... Jane's hand bounces off her nightstand turn on the light knocking over and breaking the clock ra instead.  Three alarm clocks stand next to the clock radi Finally the light comes on.  Jane's voice is so thick wit sleep the words she utters are just barely distinguishabl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncertain)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure I dialed right -- Jane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane, yes.  Tom?  Tom, is that you? Is this Tom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to sleep fast so I took two allergy pills to help me...I'm sorry...Hey, you called me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Says who?  Not important -- ha-ha-ha. I was dreaming -- Oh, no -- can't tell -- how embarrassing for me. Gosh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What pills did you take?  You sound more like someone on a general anesthetic.  Maybe I'd better speak to you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nooo.  Is it your story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Are you going to the Correspondents' Dinner on Saturday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, you need me for the story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Were you going to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I'll get off work.  I'd like to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can go together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you like me, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like you as much as I can like anyone who thinks I'm an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom editing a piece with Bobby -- He also has a little ty table set up.  He is reading from the page in the typewri he looks at the piece he has written.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But cops on the street continue to view it as... Shit -- too long.  But street cops say...that fits.  That last cut work for you, Bobbie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, and thanks for asking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the regulars watch the Evening News, in particular the Rape piece which is now in progress.  Tom anxiously eyein out of the corner of his eye as she watches the monitor. face impossible to read as she studies the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can you do?  If a woman invites a man in and he says they uh, had sex and she says he raped her and then you find out they've been out together two, three times...how can you prove a crime?

dialogues.speaker: MONITOR
dialogues.text: Tom and a woman of about thirty -- dignified but fragile looks like someone who might be cast for a church product of "Glass Menagerie."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will be a year next month since it happened...I never thought I'd talk about it outside of counseling...

dialogues.speaker: ON NEWSROOM
dialogues.text: As Aaron enters the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. He is shushed by every woman in the room, accepts this an up a position near Tom and Jane to watch them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd gone out twice and I hadn't enjoyed myself that much but it gets to a point -- I don't know if you can appreciate this but where you don't want to sit home or be with your girlfriends and people had always been telling me that I was 'too picky.' I'm not.  It's just you want to meet a nice guy...So anyways, it was that 'give-him-a-chance' thing.  No, it wasn't.  I was lonely.  So we went to a movie and when he brought me home he said could he just come up and have one beer and then he'd go.  How do you say 'no', to that?  So first it was this wrestling match which was awful enough because it got to be really a fight...because I'm a modest person... then he ripped my clothes and he  forced me to...make love.  He stayed in my apartment and forced me more times -- he didn't leave until... (she has started to cry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promised myself I wouldn't cry... It's just hard not to -- (ruefully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure have a sympathetic face. (she cries a bit more)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I was so sure I wouldn't do this -- but the whole thing messed me up -- maybe more than it should...

dialogues.speaker: ON MONITOR
dialogues.text: As the news piece cut to:  Tom's face -- he turns clearin from his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ON NEWSROOM
dialogues.text: These watching struck -- perhaps embarrassed but riveted. is aghast.  Aaron approaches the set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I turn on the news for a second? ...Oh, wait a minute.  Sex -- Tears -- This must be the news. Tom stares daggers at him as a public official appears on monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you can overestimate it -- on any given Saturday night tens of thousands of women are being attacked and there isn't much they or we can do about it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on monitor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The victims often remain too terrified to talk -- the police powerless and all the social welfare groups can finally do is monitor this epidemic of crime without punishment.  This is Tom Grunick in Annandale, Virginia. As his piece concludes.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSROOM
dialogues.text: Tom continues to glare at Aaron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in a pissy mood.  I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  I think you really blew the lid off nookie. Blair moans with displeasure.  Aaron exits scene.  Others to congratulate Tom on the piece -- in the b.g. on the:

dialogues.speaker: MONITOR
dialogues.text: We SEE frozen wilderness -- men digging in the ground -- of people watching them work.

dialogues.speaker: ON JANE
dialogues.text: Probing her own ambivalence -- or, to be more accurate, w towards a positive stance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice work... (checks watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to get a crew off the clock. She starts off -- Tom stopping her.

dialogues.speaker: ON TOM AND JANE
dialogues.text: Now off a bit by themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what did you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It moved me.  I did relate to it -- I really did.  It was unusual for you to cut to yourself when you tear up -- and that might not have been my choice...but it's real and it got me...and I think a lot of the time I'm too conservative about that kind of stuff.  Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enormously pleased)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He walks back towards the area of the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow the jury returns to this site as each day brings more revelations of horror, four more bodies now taken from the frozen earth...This is Jennifer Mack in Wota Hamlet, Alaska.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ernie's been looking for you. As Aaron walks to his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he enters and finds Ernie bent over his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I was just writing you a note. What do you say we take a walk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ernie is silent... He's having difficulty.  Aaron is feel form.  Finally Ernie breaks his silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if we have any younger man more respected in our operation than you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell me what's really going on.  I think we know each other well enough for me to expect that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (agitated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know each other well enough for me to care how I put something to you which could wipe you out. So I will phrase things the way I think they should be phrased.  All right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wipe me out? Ernie sits on a bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway.  I want you to think of this as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just blunt talk, okay?  I'd really appreciate bluntness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upper management thinks you're dull. Aaron deflates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron, I've never seen them like this -- I think Paul's nervous about his own job and for some reason he thinks you only appeal to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.  Bullshit me a little...I'm beginning to appreciate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm no suggesting the worst will happen...but someone with your brilliance gets nibbles about other jobs and maybe, the next time that happens, down the road -- you should look into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emotional)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, damn -- the fucking jerks -- My, God.  They want to fire me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I know is that they've got to fire a large number of people... and they're not going by seniority. There's a recklessness in the air.   They...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do one thing to me?  Get me one shot at anchoring the Weekend News -- they've never seen me do it.  I think it could turn them around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could do it this Saturday -- everyone wants off for the Correspondents' Dinner. Aaron turns -- his spirit lifted by the unexpected ray of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please prepare carefully.  This couldn't come at a better time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prepare what?  You have Saturday's news handy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been a while since you read the news -- I'll have somebody work with you.  Just on superficial performance things. Several beats. ERNIE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  I think I'd better be alone for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.  I'll go with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron is seated behind a desk -- some old news copy in his hand.  An unmanned camera is pointing at him.  Tom is standing a few feet further back studying him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is uncomfortable for me -- because, well, I don't mean it as a knock, but we approach this differently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We sure do.  I don't mean it as a knock either. (he smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead.  I'll just say what I think and you can disregard it if you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just might not work for me because of our different approaches. Tom nods and gestures that he proceed.  Aaron begins read the news.  Barely a sentence in, he is interrupted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your coat jacket is rising up in  back. Aaron ignores the tip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you sit down -- sit on your jacket a little -- that gives you a good line.  Look at yourself in the monitor. Aaron looks but is unimpressed and resumes reading the ne Tom, not about to be ignored when he knows it's important behind Aaron and begins to force his jacket down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very uncomfortable)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like being handled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit on it!  Now look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just don't physically... (he sees himself in the monitor and is suddenly enthusiastic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fantastic tip -- fantastic. He starts to read again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  That's not going to tell us anything.  Let's get this prompter going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not loaded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll find some copy.  Be right back. Tom exits -- Aaron looking after him, clearly taken with genuine camaraderie... the unmistakable joy Tom derives f helping out.  Several beats and Tom comes back with a CAM tow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got copy, I got Ellen to heat up the camera and I got Master Control taping so you can study it later. He puts the roll of copy in the prompter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Tom... Tom turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm very appreciative.

dialogues.speaker: SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: Tom totally focused on him down one knee checking him fro various angles.  He interrupts.  Aaron reading from the p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let your eyes go from the beginning of the sentence to the end like that.  You don't want to look shifty, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God, no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the left side of your face is the good one.  Go again.  And try to punch one word or phrase in every sentence -- punch one idea a story.  Punch -- come on -- Aaron does same with the story he is reading...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good...very nice. Aaron acknowledges the compliment in news mode.  Punching first words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for the compliment, Tom. He draws a laugh from the Cameraman as he goes right into next story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try not to move your head or wrinkle your forehead...this is good, very good...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron, tape in head, is saying his farewell to Tom.  He i his left side as he will do for the rest of his life on e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were smokin' toward the end there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pointers were great.  I'll study the tape. Tom is into helping Aaron he finds himself delivering a l room pep talk:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And remember -- you're not just reading the news or narrating.  Everybody has to sell a little.  You're selling them this idea of you.  You know, what you're sort of saying is, 'trust me.  I'm, uh, credible.'  So whenever you catch yourself just reading...stop and start selling a little.  So long. He moves off -- Aaron watching him go, feeling decidedly uncomfortable by this last piece of advice and vaguely co

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane FLIES INTO FRAME, carrying her dress, two large shou pads clipped to her bra-straps.  She is obviously running late.  Now she slips on the dress -- her pace so quickene it momentarily dulls the effect of seeing her in a pretty gown; the kind good girls wear on special nights.  The DO RINGS... She opens the door while trying to put on her ne Aaron enters carrying four bulging garment bags and a fis of neckties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spilled some rum on the outfit you picked out.  Let me show you the alternates. She eyes the amount of clothing, goes to the phone and di

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom...why don't I meet you there? I've got some last minute stuff I've got to take care of...Hey, how did you resolve your dilemma -- did you rent the tux or buy it...I knew it. How much?  Wow...Okay...See you there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know you were going with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you bring your grey suit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...I was thinking that way too... Which tie? She holds them in her hand -- indicates with the necklace she wants him to help her... he fastens her necklace whil over her bare right shoulder as she riffles through his t collection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the clasp in place)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.  Try this one. She hands him the tie and he extracts his grey jacket fro puts it on and ties the tie... She reaches into a white p full of fresh purchases and takes out a vial of perfume w built-in atomizer and sprays the air in front of hr and w the mist.  ON Aaron's reaction:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read about it -- that's how you can make sure you don't put on too much perfume...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you at least pretend that this is an awkward situation for you -- me showing up while you're getting ready for a date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flaring)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a date.  It's co-workers going to a professional conclave. Jane, unnoticed, reaches into the paper bag, takes a smal of condoms and drops it into her evening bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane on a public phone, Aaron standing nearby within sigh of a taxi stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long will it tale you to send one?... She hangs up... paces... Then looks at Aaron, relaxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look terrific. Aaron poses a question which he feels in his deepest core

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Jane nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because this is important -- so don't just be polite.  I'd really like to look...what's the word I'm looking for?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As good as humanly possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the line of the jacket -- No really....just very nice...just right. I wish I could be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too...Hey...if it gets dull a little before 11:00, drop by the studio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure I'll be able to...I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If...if not, I'll have the tape...I'll wait for you at my apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, great -- good luck. Before she can deal with that, a cab arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Jane.  Have a good time tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too. Aaron takes her in -- she looks lovely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd hug you, but why risk mussing either of us? She half-laughs... kisses him, wipes the slight lipstick from his cheek and, in a sudden decision, takes each of h shoulder pads from her jacket and puts them in his -- imp his look while diminishing her own.  She gets in the cab. AARON'S P.O.V. Jane, leaning all the way over the front seat, giving det instructions to the DRIVER as the cab pulls away... As Aa turns and walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane, in her formal, sitting back -- anticipating her dat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hefty percentage of the Washington journalism industry' men and women dressed formally for one of those evenings they can finally assert their own glamour.  Jane ENTERS T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jane enters, lost momentarily in the lobby -- greenhou the majority of the throng passing through in formal clot A bit of DIALOGUE OVERHEAD from TWO MEN in dinner jackets

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The L.A. times is a great outfit.  Best severance pay in the business. Jane keeps looking for Tom -- passing another MAN, talkin his SHARP-LOOKING DATE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was lecturing me and finally I just said -- I'm sorry, I refuse to look at it as a negative that I'm young and my news appeals to people my age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's not like he just didn't hire a twenty-six-year-old producer himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No kidding, twenty-six. Jane moves to the steps and starts up, greeting several people nervously.  More bits of DIALOGUE, leaking from conversations of both substance and expedience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember Brinkley's great line -- "It's as irrevocable as a haircut." Now, on the second level, she scans the crowd. JANE'S P.O.V. The floor below.  Tom in the world's best-fitting tux... of people from around him but he works his way easily thr as he looks for Jane and grins his greetings, men are buo women's pulses throb.

dialogues.speaker: ON JANE
dialogues.text: As she silently mouths the words -- "smile and move and s and move."  Which is exactly what he's doing.  Then a con with the gods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he doesn't see me soon, we're not supposed to be together.

dialogues.speaker: ON TOM
dialogues.text: Seeing her.  -- He does a tap step -- a brief giddy burst meaning of which is not lost on Jane.  He is acting like boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: ON JANE
dialogues.text: Anxiety stripped away revealing a first glimpse of Jane a joyous pretty young woman.

dialogues.speaker: ON TOM
dialogues.text: Moving quickly up the stairs -- as she walks toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excitedly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's incredible who's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me! She laughs.  Almost completes an affectionate gesture -- his arm instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron seated in the main newsroom in shirt-sleeves, writi takes the just-completed page out of the typewriter and w to the weekend news PRODUCER. (W.N.P.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to look at this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. George Weln appears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Aaron)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feigning casualness)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The weekend news...anchoring... anchoring the weekend news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way to go. Aaron nods, as the Producer finishes the copy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is terrific news, Aaron.  It's a pleasure to read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.  Oh, there's water on the set, isn't there, in case I get an attack of cotton mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  You'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feeling patronized and repelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be fine!  Yes!!  I know!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bomb sniffing dogs, SECRET SERVICE MEN and D.C. POLICE mo the members of Washington's most trustworthy elite as the through the metal detector.  The line moves slowly -- Jan Tom several couples back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have your autograph for my wife? Tom and Jane turn to see a grinning Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing, Paul?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this is why you wouldn't do the Weekend New, you can't turn down a free meal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, born to party. Paul enjoys the riposte, looks at Jane who is shrinking w herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you two inside -- I think we're all at the same table. (sotto to Jane)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're finally learning to be flexible. Glad you changed your mind about Tom. He passes through the detector... Tom starts to step thro she pulls him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  I don't want to go in there and sit with everybody. (imagining it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't...why don't you go? He considers this option as she waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suppose I go in for a little while and you wait in the lobby-bar.  How's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  That's it...See you. She walks off.  He runs a few steps to stop her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane. She turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to take off on me, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-uh. She steps on the escalator... Riding upwards, concern dee anxiety flows.

dialogues.speaker: ON TOM
dialogues.text: Watching her to up the escalator, he finds himself doing simplest thing, stepping onto a moving step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane four steps ahead of him -- not yet aware of him.  He past one other man until he is standing directly behind h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want you to know that my giving up the Correspondents' Dinner puts tremendous pressure on you. Jane turns and is a bit blown away by his gesture -- life threatens to be good.  And now Jane bumps a bit at the to the escalator, regaining her balance by grabbing Tom's of hand.  As they walk they continue to deliberately hold ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE are on the studio floor, FOCUSING on the activity arou the Anchor Desk and three cameras... The FLOOR MANAGER st ready to cue Aaron, the script is ready to roll on the pr machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: ON AARON
dialogues.text: Making sure he is seated on his jacket -- taking one last at the hand mirror being held by the MAKEUP WOMAN.  She s off -- but Aaron regrabs the mirror almost making her los footing -- a check -- then another check -- he points to on his forehead which she dabs with the makeup sponge... them fuss enormously with his hair -- four busy hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. He watches the Makeup Woman scurry underneath a camera le resits on his jacket and finally has the moment the syste been denying him for years.  We can HEAR the END OF HIS C in a barely AUDIBLE CRACKLE from the Floor Manager's earp "...with Aaron Altman."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on TV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good Evening...In mood and language better suited to an espionage novel than the delicate world of the Western Alliance, the British Foreign Secretary today pounced on what he termed, 'The nest of profession spies and amateur traitors who were turning NATO Headquarters into an instrument whose only true function is folly.'  We begin our coverage with Edward Towne in London. Aaron looks up -- takes a breath.  He's done well -- he's punched his words and his one thought for the story.  His has been steady, his voice firm but he has begun to persp He dabs with his finger at the first trickles from his br brushes some more prominent sweat from his upper lip... H beckons nervously to the Makeup Woman -- who comes in and then dabs again as Aaron feels himself under his arms...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee whiz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five seconds. She scurries away, Aaron reaching for another Kleenex fro box and missing it... A graphic illustrating his next scr section appears behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the sub-bases referred to are located in five countries... And now the moisture on his face is clearly discernible - Floor Manager and Makeup Woman grimacing at the growing s as they look at a large monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: France, Belgium, the Netherlands, Spain as... And now so much moisture sprouts from his upper lip that pushes his lower lip out to slurp away the sweat... The M Woman laughs briefly out loud before catching herself... Aaron's eyes dart angrily in her direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We well as Great Britain...Our own State Department was rocked not only by the revelation but from the highly unusual persistence from the State  Press Corps.  Martin Klein reports on  the ruckus at Foggy Bottom. Half-beat until he's sure that he's off -- his shirt now showing distinct sweat stains...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me. The Makeup Woman picks up her Kleenex box -- then thinks better of it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone finds me some big towels.

dialogues.speaker: ON AARON
dialogues.text: He blots his face -- some makeup streaked -- by the towel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five seconds.

dialogues.speaker: ON MAKEUP WOMAN
dialogues.text: As she scurries away, this time entering the control room trotting up one stair to look at the monitor... the Direc talking to his Camera Operators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd go looser but we wouldn't see the graphic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to other Technician)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- this is more than Nixon ever sweated. The Makeup Woman now looks at the bank of monitors.
