dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you just die for him?

dialogues.speaker: ON MONITOR
dialogues.text: Aaron's makeup-streaked face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Jane walking drinks in hand, her arm around his w They stop -- he rests a drink on a ledge and boosts her u and then sits next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEALING that they are sitting on an anti-terrorist conc abutment protecting a major government building on a beau night in our capitol.  He is still holding her hand -- an now he notes this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loudly to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't I let go of this woman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... He interrupts her with the smallest of kisses -- so mall swift a kiss that she is left doing her return kisses to air.  And then he does something he's thought about many before -- he briefly caresses her breasts -- while contin to look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least kiss me when you do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a grin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just can't stop editing me. Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is hysterical. She laughs a little -- then kisses him.  They break -- surprised and aroused and look at each other...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was half hoping I wouldn't have a good time tonight.  You know why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, right -- Isn't she fun to tease? He leans forward and speaks softly and truly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More and more lately when I've watched you in action -- seen all your energy -- I've been wondering what it would be like to be inside all that energy. She takes a gulp of her drink -- puts a hand to feel the on her own cheek.  Then turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right back at you. Several beats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember saying anything like that -- exactly...I don't know why I just did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (immediately at work)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh let's see -- wait a minute, well, I can think of two reasons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three...I just thought of a third... If you talk about it, you don't have to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good...Another is you're trying to make it all about sex and heat and nothing else. She looks at him -- he's thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or it's that great feeling that you don't want to hold anything back. You know, intimacy. She elbows him.  Tom takes in the choices -- then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit.  I'm a creep. She moves off the concrete wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgot all about Aaron.  I promised to stop by and see how he did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to know.  I'll go along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I'll see you at your apartment as soon as I can. She starts to flurry with activity -- moves to the curb w out of nowhere Tom barks a sharp command, the first time of his actions has been tinged with fury.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Thrown, she stops and turns.  He walks to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't run off --  like everything's settled the minute you make up your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He might be weird -- he can talk more freely if I go alone -- why's that so hard to understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that it's hard.  I just want you to give me a minute to catch up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. (she hugs him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. (another beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't yell at me like that again, you scared the life out of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jane exits a cab and moves up the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is at the top of a flight of steps.  She KNOCKS on the RINGS.  KNOCKS.  Aaron opens it.  He is wearing a sweatsh and cords.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in the shower. She enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd it go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't see it or speak to anybody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it went well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did it really go well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Define your terms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you feel good about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do others feel that you did well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what was good about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lost six pounds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron, will you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was great...writing my little first rate copy, sitting on my jacket, punching my one thought. But I had this historic attack of flop sweat so they'll never let me another again.  Oh, I lost one of your shoulder pads -- how was your evening anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, flop sweat? -- you're making too much out of it...I'll bet you were the only one aware of it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People phoned in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop kidding.  I want to know what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were complaining phone calls because you were sweating?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, nice ones worried that I was having a heart attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If all that happened, how come you're so chipper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  At a certain point it was so off the chart bad -- it got funny.  My central nervous system was telling me something. Jane -- sweat running down my face -- makeup falling into my eyes -- people turning this fusillade of blow dryers on me -- all so I could read introductions to other people who were covering stories which is what I like to do anyway.  And I'm chipper because you finally showed up.  I thought I'd cook for us. Tequila and eggs sound good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to be somewhere. He looks at a clock reading 1:15 in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told what's his name -- Tom -- that I'd meet him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call him -- I mean it can wait,  right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (now the plunge)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I may be in love with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as if he just burned his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!!!!! She starts for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is important to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Well...I think it is important for you too.  Sit down. She sits.  He walks to a desk and looks at her briefly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me think a second.  It's tough. A remarkably long silence -- her mind wanders, she takes it is evident that he is straining to get it right, reach into himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaach...Jane... (glancing at note)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's take the part that has nothing to do with me.  Let's let me be your most trusted friend, the one that gets to say awful things to you.  You know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (testy and wary but fair)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I guess.  Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't end up with Tom because it goes totally against everything you're about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah -- being a basket case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you care about him.  I've never seen you like this about anyone, so please don't take it wrong when I tell you that I believe that Tom, while a very nice guy, is the Devil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't friendship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think the Devil is going to look like if he's around?  Nobody is going to be taken in if he has a long, red, pointy tail.  No.  I'm semi-serious here.  He will look attractive and he will be nice and helpful and he will get a job where he influences a great God-fearing nation and he will never do an evil thing...he will just bit by little bit lower standards where they are important. Just coax along flash over substance... Just a tiny bit.  And he will talk about all of us really being salesmen. (seeing he's not reaching her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he'll get all the great women. She is getting pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're the Devil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  You know that I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because we have the kind of relationship where if I were the Devil, you'd be the only one I told. She's briefly impressed.  He has a point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were quick enough to get Tom's help when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes.  I know.  Right.  And if it had gone well for me tonight, maybe I'd be keeping quiet about all this...I grant you everything but give me this...he does personify everything you've been fighting against...And I'm in love with you. (realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you like that? -- I buried the lead. He pauses to catch his breath -- breathing deeply through nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (an aside)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to not say that aloud; it takes too much out of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thawing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, stop. Aaron slumps down -- it's been a long round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never fought for anyone before. Does anybody win one of these things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CAR DOOR SLAMS in the street below -- he goes towards t window which is blocked by his sofa -- puts his knees in looks out. TOM'S P.O.V. A woman walking from a car.

dialogues.speaker: ON TOM
dialogues.text: Momentarily thinking it's Jane.  Elated. TOM'S P.O.V. It is not Jane.  The PHONE RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: As he answers and we have the following conversation betw Jane, who is using the phone, with Aaron seen just a few away.  Tom in his apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.  It's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't get away just yet.  I'm  at Aaron's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, when?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure.  It seems like he had sort of a mishap on the news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  I taped it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't as bad as he think, was it? -- it wasn't unprecedented or anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if you count 'Singing in the Rain.'  Do him a favor and don't treat it like a tragedy.  You want me to talk to him? Her eyes meet Aaron's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-uh. (to Aaron)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says you could hardly notice it. Aaron beckons for the phone.  Jane hands it to him, as sh so:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say anything about anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.  Will I ever sing again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody has one like that.  I thought it was great when you started to laugh at the end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah -- well, I'm sorry I'm tying up Jane, I didn't realize you two would be going this late.  Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Don't worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll put her on. She takes the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, again.  Sorry about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  That sounds more important. Let's forget about tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if that's absolutely necessary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got my father coming through tomorrow anyway.  I should get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hampered by Aaron's presence)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you at the office.  Good night. Several beats of silence.  Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aghast)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane, I'm not some chore you have to finish so you can stay on schedule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, great, Grunick -- Easy shots now -- huh?  Good night. She puts the phone down.  A beat -- she looks stricken. looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just cancelled.  He had a chance to think and he cancelled. She bows her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't breathe. (aghast)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over a guy?!? (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I can't -- I can't breathe. Damn it! She gulps a breath.  Her hands on her knees, leaning over another deep breath.  Aaron takes in the specter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Jane, it was nice of you to drop by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she enters -- goes immediately to the phone. ON PHONE... Cradled in an answering machine -- indexes for sixteen one-button calls, mostly people from work -- "Parents" et Jane plays her answering tape.  It is silent -- no messag She fast forwards to double-check.  Just the SOUND of bla tape.  She pushes the button next to the "Tom Grunick." HEAR a busy signal.

dialogues.speaker: ON JANE
dialogues.text: She hangs up the phone.  Then compulsively hits the "Tom" button again.  Busy.  And again.  Busy.  She considers fo a moment hitting the button next to Aaron's name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopping herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be fair. She presses the button next to Tom's name.  Busy.  And ag Busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he picks up for newspapers dotting his lawn and opens door of his car -- just as his wife calls from the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ernie, they're calling from work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me I'm on the way in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Paul. Ernie, just a bit concerned, walks back to his house -- t four newspapers thick enough to be an awkward carry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A phone in the immaculate living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.  Yes... He holds the phone down at his side for a beat, composing himself in the face of a sudden and horrible turn of even

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would there be any point to my going         to New York and talking to them?  Would there be any point in going over it with you?  No, I'm still coming in. He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They fired me. She takes his hand and kisses it -- then hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weeping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How horrible.  We'll be fine.  You'll be fine.  Stay here with me -- we'll go for a drive, have some drinks, make happy plans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  They're firing even more people than they said.  Some will want to talk.  It could help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (timidly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could use somebody to talk to on a day like this. (on his reaction)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Go ahead. He kisses her sad face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, sweetie. He walks towards the door -- picks up his newspapers on t tray beneath the hall mirror and does a start. HIS P.O.V. In the mirror he SEES his wife making faces at him behind back.  He EXITS his home without comment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane is sitting in her editing cubby -- it is past noon. rises and stands in her doorway looking toward Tom's offi the door is open, the room is empty.  Blair ENTERS carryi an armload of tapes.  She looks extraordinary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got four hours of French demonstrations -- Jane waves it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of it they use water cannons. Jane takes the tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you dressed up for?  Oh, that's right -- because the Evening News is here this week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spent a fortune on this. Blair EXITS... Jane pops the tape in, automatically makin timing notes, then standing -- looking again towards Tom' door. JANE'S P.O.V. The door now closed.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: She stops the tape -- summons herself.  She walks towards office and opens the door.  Tom is seated behind his desk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without passion)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kept trying to call you -- you never called me.  Were you just diddling me?  Is that it--?  I'm great if I'm helping your career. (mimicking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But when I'm a woman for a second, I get immediately fucked around by you. She is obviously in pain but still alert enough to catch answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane, this is my Dad. And, now OPENING the door a bit more -- Tom's father is R seated across from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (that quickly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please forgive what I said. (to Tom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. As she retreats:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just light up a room and leave, huh? She laughs nervously as she exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want my opinion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thing that's easy to miss about Jane is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want my opinion?  And it's okay if you don't. Tom thinks a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way she just acted is not the way an affectionate person acts. Tom finds the comment off-the-wall enough to be thought provoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul arriving with Bill Rorish.  The first time we have s the multi-millionaire anchorman in the flesh.  He has the and dignity of a man who spends every waking moment worki grace and dignity, He and Paul are in the midst of an important conversation muted and ominous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just when do you start, telling people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to take everyone out after the show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill...This is hard on all of us and it's no time for compliments. But I think it's extraordinary of you to come down here for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we're not here for each other during the tough time, we're not a news organization. Blair ENTERS scene.  The smallest flicker of interest fro but more than enough to justify her going into hock for t outfit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome back to Washington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. A self-conscious look of greeting to Paul and she's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've forgotten.  Was she on the list? Paul nods "yes."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a brutal layoff...And all because they couldn't program Wednesdays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (can't resist)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can make it a little less brutal by knocking a million dollars or so off your salary. AS Bill turns:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a bad joke.  I'm sorry.  Awful. It's a miserable day and that was some kind of totally sick-joke defense mechanism which does not indicate any of my feelings -- not one -- but just shows the kind of stress this represents for all of us. Tom and his Father ENTER the scene from Tom's office.  Bi walks to Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.  It's about time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to see you, Bill. AS they shake:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A great handshake.

dialogues.speaker: ON MR. GRUNICK'S FACE
dialogues.text: touched, as he watches the networks' most prominent journ greet his son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to meet you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: ON TOM
dialogues.text: Equally touched as he watches the world's most prominent journalist greet his Dad, who turns goofy with excitement

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-bye, Tom. He puts a big hand on his son's cheek -- a farewell pat. whispers in his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to go back home and tell all your old teachers. Tom watches his father walk off and moves immediately to editing room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AS Tom enters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel terrible about what happened. What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He -- uh -- said he liked you because you looked like you had -- fire and honesty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enormously pleased)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Did he really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Then he said a really weird thing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (so softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he means this)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That it would be a treat to make someone like you feel better... He gets like that sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's so perfectly...It really makes me feel a little faint... (actually woozy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whooo. Blair enters wildly into the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They canned me.  Well, my brother will feel great -- now he's not the only screw-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's started. Bobbie sticks his head out of his office...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom -- Paul wants to see you. AS Tom focuses and moves off:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving with Tom.  Nervousness growing, confidence gone, h proceeds down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll just be a minute. Tom sits down -- pats his tie in place... A beat and the opens.  Paul leads out Martin Klein.  They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I'm just old enough to be flattered by the term, 'early retirement.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's wonderful...what a lovely line. If there's anything I can do. They shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (evenly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I certainly hope you die soon. A little smile to Tom and he's off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom. Tom enters the room.  A nervous cough in evidence as he crosses to a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're having a severe cutback, Tom -- 17 people in this bureau including technical personnel and we're going to reorganize at the same time. We're going to take you out of Washington for a while and assign you to London.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron and Ernie are off to the side in the newsroom -- Pe are packing their belongings -- as secretaries cry and em from an office rumbles a shouted denunciation:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I won't keep my voice down. Those sons-of-bitches...They are worse than accountants -- they are bad accountants. Tom enters scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you guys seen Jane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's in there becoming the first woman bureau chief we've had here. Tom takes this in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did they do with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They booted me out of Washington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impossible.  There's no system that wouldn't value one of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  What did they do to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing at Aaron)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what he did.  I'm proud of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They told me they'd keep me because they could plug me into any story and my salary was in line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cost-efficient reporter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I quit. A weeping woman bursts into their circle and sweeps Ernie Tom and Aaron stand there -- comrades at last -- victims the same sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You packing up tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  And I'm sorry that they're sending you down for a while, but you'll make it back...Where they sending you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: London.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incensed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: London.  That's a promotion!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensively)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is.  Yes -- that's where they had Rorish, for God's sake, before they made him anchor.  I can't stand it -- they're grooming you for it all and you don't even know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it down, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask you something?  You only had one crew on the date rape piece, right? He extends his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  You're not going to stick around for the farewell party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I don't know how much fun it will be when Martin Klein and Ernie have to drop off their credentials with the security guard. Aaron looks at people packing their belongings in boxes - few pockets of conversation... Ernie reading some copy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This story they won't cover.  And if the network doesn't cover it -- it must not be important so why worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyeing him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to miss you -- you're a prick in a great way... Aaron taken by surprise -- laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I liked the way it made me sound. Okay.  Be good.  So long. He exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AS he picks up a clean wastebasket and deposits his belon A scheduled book, clean shirt, two ties, cuff-links, a tr mirror, cassettes of his Washington reporting.  His desk he writes on a clean piece of copy paper.  He centers it desk.

dialogues.speaker: PAPER
dialogues.text: "Good luck, you'll love the bureau chief... Previous Occu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AS Tom enters from his office, a wake is slowly igniting. moves along the edge of the room, carrying his wastebaske of belongings, not really a part of the mournful festivit TOM'S P.O.V. Jane across the room hugging one person after another.

dialogues.speaker: ON JANE
dialogues.text: AS she embraces an older secretary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I always wanted to tell you -- that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh.  This isn't the last time we'll see each other.  It's not. A two-armed tight embrace of Martin Klein.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get them back -- it's going to change. Blair is at hand as they embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except for socially, you're my role model. And now she sees Tom -- he mouths one word at her -- "Lon She nods that she already knows and then lets her body sa little.  He gestures her towards her editing room, so the rendezvous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AS Tom enters and waits for Jane.  When she enters he clo the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These people -- it's all so awful. It just hurts physically, doesn't it?  Like something's wrong with your bones, like your organs are shifting inside your body. She looks at him expectantly.  It's not what he's feeling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I haven't been here long enough. (great)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, hey, congratulations on the promotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you say that to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't stand here feeing bad that I don't feel worse.  This has happened at every station I ever worked for. Look, I think it's crazy for you to come in here tomorrow and start a new job.  I have a week to get to my job.  Let's get the hell away to some island fast and find out how we are together away from this. A beat -- Jane takes it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I just think that' an extraordinary  proposal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's more than 'yes' -- that's 'you bet.' They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone rings.  He answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane -- still at the office -- it is quite late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bastard, sneak, quitter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just found out.  You didn't say anything to me?  You just resign? Will you meet me now? -- No, now! I'm going away tomorrow.  Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the street from the bureau's building.  Aaron and are having a beer.  They are in mid-conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not try it for a few weeks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop.  Ernie thought I was good too -- he couldn't help.  My agent has a hot prospect -- the number two station in Portland.  The general manager says he wants to be every bit as good as the networks.  Personally, I think he should aim higher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me the God's honest truth -- are you leaving because of me? Because if you are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ernie told this story.  How he used to write obits and when the people in town called him up with death notices, he cried.  He was till that way when they promoted him out of obits.  He says you're lucky if you can get out while you could still cry. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have quit this place  three years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just trying to say all great stuff so I'll feel even worse that you're not around. He laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to sit here longer, I mean the feeling is powerful -- why's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe the best part of your life is over and you don't want to get up and start the bad part. Jane looks at him levelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are now required to sit here with me. (a beat; then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on...be smart for a second -- what do you think will happen to us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, that's very easy.  Five, six years from now I'll be in town to collect an award representing the surge in foreign coverage by local stations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smile, it's like  old times)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be walking with my wife and two children -- we'll bump into you on the street, my youngest son will say something and I'll tell him... (deliberately)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...it's not nice to make fun of single, fat ladies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't be able to stay mad at me, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope so... (on her look he relents)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I'm not really mad. (nodding head as if reciting a catechism)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll miss you, we'll talk, we'll always be friends...we'll get hot for each other every few years at dinner and never act on it, okay? Jane smiles -- Aaron has grown suddenly angry.  He rises, walks away, then turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane, you know how Tom had tears in the piece the other night?  Ask yourself how we were able to see them when he only had one camera and that was pointing at the girl during the interview. (on her reaction)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fairly sure I was right to tell  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We LOOK THROUGH THE WINDOW as Jane enters -- in a frenzy searching the stacks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she locates the cassette labelled "DATE-RAPE - 9/26 -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she inserts the tape into the player.

dialogues.speaker: JANE... AND MONITOR
dialogues.text: As she watches... this is what she sees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but the whole thing messed me up more than it should. She cries.  We HEAR Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, that will do it.  You okay? The tape is rocky now -- the Sound Woman and Cameraman continue to roll as they move towards their next shot -- at times the camera pointing towards the carpet -- but the sound continues.  The crew chatting -- mentioning that the tape is still rolling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough.  That's enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be silly.  What are you sorry  about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way you were looking at me, I just went. Tom moves through the SHOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just need you for another minute now, so we can shoot from behind towards me, and, um...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...that way we have someplace to go when  we cut.  And I just sit here, I nod my  head and look nerdy. Young Woman chuckles. Jane chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It kills me we didn't have a second camera.   It was so powerful seeing your reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a second there, I thought you were  gonna cry yourself.  That would have  been something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (considering, then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then give me a minute...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fully realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking... As Jane watches we SEE Tom work up the tears we saw in th Evening News piece -- as he does so:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's amazing. ON Jane's shocked reaction:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane's cab pulls up to the curb.  She gets out -- she is carrying no luggage.  She sees Tom who hurriedly walks up to her.  Jane is fighting to maintain a calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look who's the organized one. I've got everything. He briefly opens a paper gift shop bag he is holding and her he has bought them each a bathing suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going. He looks at her with anticipatory distaste evident on his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw the taped outtakes of the interview with the girl.  I know you 'acted' your reaction after the interview. Tom half turns from her and moves back toward the bench. behind, stalking him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I felt funny about it afterwards.  It's verboten, huh?  I thought since I did it for real the first time -- but I get you.  That's not the reason you're not coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raising her voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it's the reason.  It's terrible what you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We disagree on how God-awful it was.  Why don't you come with me and we can disagree and get a tan at the same time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (livid)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, if you're glib about this I'm going to lose it.  I was up all night and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane, Jane, Jane, Jane, Jane...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It made me ill.  You could get fired for things like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got promoted for things like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Working up tears for a new piece cutaway...You totally crossed the line between...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard not to cross it; they keep moving the little sucker, don't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distaste)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just proves that the difference we  have are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a one-way argument.  We've got six days; if you go and we fight and we hate it -- we'll come home.  If you don't go?  Well, that's a much bigger deal.  I go to London right after that. So, it'd be very big deal if you stay here.  The plane's boarding.  You're good at deadline.  Here's your ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking ticket)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's amazing.  You commit this incredible breach of ethics and you act as if I'm nitpicking.  Try and get this.  When you edited that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deliberately)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm leaving now.  Gate 43. He simply turns and walks away -- looking back once as Ja stands there mucked up by his sudden departure -- the lac of resolution to their confrontation is palpable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Tom moving past the metal detector.  He too is frustra -- pissed off at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane moving quickly along towards the metal detectors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jane passes through and sets off the buzzer.  She stan there -- the heel of her hand pressed to her brow trying stem the tears.  As others look on, she takes a huge key from her pocket -- deposits it in the box -- walks throug without a buzzer and moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom waiting while in the b.g.  "People Eater" busses ferr passengers to the plane. As one full "People Eater" pulls away and another empty o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the last one. Others start to board.  He sees Jane moving towards him. He walks to her, she gestures back towards the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not going to be the way we say good-bye.  Even though I think what you did was rotten -- it's not all impersonal.  You mean something to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You keep coming after me and looking down on me.  It's starting to make me batty. She looks at him. TOM (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't help it that they like me. And I like that they like me.  And I think there's a lot of this job that I do well.  What do you think it takes to do this job -- the way they have it now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wan to discuss work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let's do a special report on that...I mean that's news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew what you meant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I don't know, I can learn and what I know, nobody can teach. Excuse me for saying it about myself, but I think it's true. (old habit)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think? (catching himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind what you think. They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lucky I came after you so you got that off your...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I am.  Thanks.  I mean it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir? The pressure begins to bend Jane's resolve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you have an extra bathing suit, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wary but hopeful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (totally open)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just that one of the few things I'm not confused about is what I was saying downstairs, that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giving up -- sadly, finally)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you should stay here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's better when you let me say it. He hugs her.  Now that it's over, they can each openly ca for each other.  While in the embrace:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did I have to do this to myself?  Watch you take off. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me if you need anything. He kisses her lightly -- looking at her... Then heartfelt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, honey. He walks to the People Eater and gets on, still holding h paper bags of bathing suits.  The bus pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: ON JANE
dialogues.text: Watching him go. JANE'S P.O.V. Tom standing at the front window of the bus -- framed ver much as he is when on television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane gets quickly into cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning. (after collecting herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dupont Circle, please. The cab pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't take the beltway, because at this time of day there's gonna be a lot... (stops herself, then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Go any way you want. She sits back in the seat (containing herself) before fin quietly adding what she knows to be true:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But New York Avenue's faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much the same place where Jane and Tom first met.  The words "SEVEN YEAS LATER" appears on the screen. A sign off to one side tells us it's the annual meeting o Local Television Broadcasters... and that at 2 P.M.  Tom will be speaking on "Responsibilities of Broadcast Journa for the '90s."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much the same audience, though two members of the audienc may strike particular interest -- curly haired man seen from behind holding a similarly curly haired five-year-ol Tom is in mid-speech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... when they told me Bill had decided to retire and offered me the Evening News, I thought it was the same kind of joke we used to pull back at the station -- turning off somebody's prompter in the middle of a show. Some good-natured laughter. TOM (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then when they heard my reaction -- they thought I was kidding.  I told them I'd be their anchor but I didn't want to be the Managing Editor -- that there were people better qualified than I to  control the content and if there  weren't we were all in trouble. The audience really enjoys this:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The anchor teams -- leaning forward.  They love this man, a humble specialist refusing the generalist trap.  Imagin the feeling -- you see, on the top of the mountain, a man not unlike yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now to something more important... I'd like to introduce my bride. (gestures to a woman in the front row)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila? A svelte, classic, warm beauty gets to her feet. ON CURLY HAIRED MAN AND BOY... Aaron and his son as Aaron cranes for a look at Mrs. Grun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Lila shaking hand.  Aaron, his son in his arms, w

dialogues.speaker: ON TOM
dialogues.text: As he sees Aaron... he is clearly delighted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit, Aaron. He claps him on the back... Aaron is as pleased as he is uncomfortable with the attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila -- this is Aaron Altman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (high British accent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes -- you're one of Tom's 50 or so role models.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, this kid couldn't possibly belong to anyone else.  What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clifford...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating Tom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know who this is, Cliff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The big joke? Tom looks at him -- Aaron gives his son a disciplinary nu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just bringing him over to give Jane a look at him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought she'd be here.  I'll go with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lila)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you back at the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cool)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. He starts off.  She pulls him back for an urgent communic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom, the speech was magnificent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I didn't say anything about your speech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom, Aaron and the boy walking along.  Tom plays with Cli as they move.  The boy is delighted.  Jane is in a park - blanket spread out -- she is wearing shorts and a top -- has some wine and a small picnic -- a toy for Clifford. She HEARS her name being called.

dialogues.speaker: ON JANE
dialogues.text: Shielding her eyes from the sun -- now making out Tom.  A they reach her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, why not? (as they arrive)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what is this?  My life's rushing in front of my eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A picnic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought for ol' Cliff here -- Look at you?  You're more adorable than your pictures.  Look what I got for you. She hands him a toy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you say, Cliff? The boy kisses Jane's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He excels at gratitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jane)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you any closer to a decision?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so...They've been talking to me about being Tom's Managing Editor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a great surprise.  I didn't think we had a chance.  I heard you wanted to stay in Washington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there's a guy, but he says he'll fly up a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we should talk.  You going to have time for  dinner?  I'd like you to meet Lila.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry because I was looking forward to that, but I' m going back in a few hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...It's so good to see you. She gives him a quick kiss.  He shakes hands with Aaron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Aaron)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nice to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations on history's longest winning streak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you ever get restless in Portland, let me know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Tom shuffles uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: ON JANE
dialogues.text: Smiling, appreciating Aaron's attitude toward a blandishm powerful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jane as he leaves)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye...boss. Tom walks away.  He's a good twenty yards away when Aaron to see his son running after Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Cliff!  Cliff! Tom now notices the boy, leans down and pats him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Clifford)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back to your daddy. The boy starts back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Cliff.  Come on. As Clifford runs back to his father, Aaron sits next to J

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jane)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who's the guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we met about three months ago. He works at the surgeon general office. He loves boating.  So, he's been  getting me into water skiing. Aaron laughs at the very notion of Jane finding water spo Jane deliberately moves past this moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it!  So, doll, what about you lately?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- my wife got this new job... He continues to talk.  As the two former colleagues catch their ease returns, if not their intimacy, as the frame l the scene slowly recedes into a black b.g. and we...
